image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The public service commissioner names former department bosses Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon among a dozen current and former senior public servants found to have breached their duties in relation to the unlawful Robodebt scheme.

title.children: Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon breached duties over Robodebt, public service commissioner finds

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the decision to strip medals from former army commanders in the same week the royal commission into veteran suicide was released was an "insensitive" move by Defence Minister Richard Marles.

title.children: 'Insensitivity': Dutton accuses defence minister of disservice to diggers in timing of decision to strip medals

image.altText: Casey Munro sits at his desk in his spare room patting his cat

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission is reviewing whether administrative workers should be included under an award that would give them the right to work from home.

title.children: More Aussie workers may have the right to work from home

image.altText: Police officers surround a woman in a car.

props.synopsis: A woman who set her hand in concrete as part of a protest against the Land Forces expo has been arrested by police as the demonstration against the event continues for a third day.

title.children: Woman who set hand in concrete arrested in Melbourne as Land Forces expo protest enters third day

image.altText: A close up of Yvonne Buters wearing a black shirt with white flowers on it, looking directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Stronger protections for older Australians and hefty fines for providers who breach standards are part of the federal government's sweeping changes to the aged care sector.

title.children: Woman whose parents deteriorated quickly in aged care hopes new laws will hold providers accountable

image.altText: A mosaic of news photos, some fake and AI-created, including one of Taylor Swift, with blue ticks and red exclamation marks

props.synopsis: Every time you pick up your phone, you have to decide what's true and what's fake. And it's getting harder.

title.children: Most Australians struggle to spot what's real and what's fake. Here's some help

image.altText: a man walking with cameras in front following

props.synopsis: A second man accused of the murder of Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson has been acquitted by a jury and will be released after more than three years in custody.

title.children: Second man accused of murdering Gold Coast woman Kelly Wilkinson acquitted by a jury

image.altText: Ilya Fomin stands near a front door

props.synopsis: Despite consulting with bank staff before transferring his life savings, Ilya Fomin lost $280,000 to scammers. His bank hasn't accepted any responsibility — new scam laws may change that.

title.children: Ilya's life savings were stolen when he transferred $280K from NAB to Commonwealth Bank. Both banks and his law firm say it's not their fault

image.altText: Donald Trump opens his hands wide as he speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Here's how a baseless claim about Haitian migrants made it onto the US presidential debate stage.

title.children: A man claimed migrants were killing ducks in the park. In just two weeks, that rumour had spread to Donald Trump

image.altText: Police and SES workers in orange outside a rural property.

props.synopsis: A witness has described trying to come to the aid of a man who died in a light plane crash in central Victoria.

title.children: Pilot dies in central Victorian light plane crash

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen ride a military vehicle.

props.synopsis: Moscow's forces begin a counteroffensive in the Kursk region, claiming to have recaptured 10 settlements seized by Ukrainian forces in a surprise incursion into western Russia last month.

title.children: 'They will outnumber them': Russia begins counter-offensive in Kursk

image.altText: Council members and staff sit around a round table. More more than 60 chairs arranged in three rows around it.

props.synopsis: By adding two members from the African continent and one island state, the international body for peace and security could reframe its focus, or get even more dysfunctional.

title.children: After 80 years, Africa could finally become part of the UN's most powerful body

image.altText: An aerial shot, rendered, showing the roofs of three buildings and a courtyard connecting them

props.synopsis: Established suburbs are often left out of the housing crisis discussion, but an architecture expert has an innovative idea that could be part of the solution.

title.children: Many families dream of living in a leafy older suburb. Here's a new way to make that possible for more people

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers, Minister for Aged Care Anika Wells and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: This week saw a huge flurry of government activity — it's as if the government looked up at the clock and saw time was rapidly getting away from it. But what loomed largest was tying down the aged care deal.

title.children: Why Dutton backed Albanese's aged care reforms

image.altText: Tim Southee and Jonathan Trott

props.synopsis: Afghanistan will have to wait a little longer to play Test cricket against New Zealand, with their first ever Test washed out without a ball being bowled.

title.children: Afghanistan vs New Zealand Test sets unwanted record

image.altText: Dustin Martin during 2024 AFL season.

props.synopsis: Richmond great Dustin Martin may come out of a short-lived retirement and reunite with Damian Hardwick after the Gold Coast Suns confirm they have had a "conversation" with the three-time premiership player.

title.children: Dustin Martin holds talks with Gold Coast Suns as speculation grows he'll come out of retirement

image.altText: A picture of an elderly woman with a younger woman.

props.synopsis: Some experts say Australia needs to focus on prevention and strengthening primary care to effectively deal with the projected rise in dementia.

title.children: The number of Australians living with dementia projected to more than double by 2058

image.altText: Trump and Harris shake hands on a blue stage carpeted with a lectern in front of them

props.synopsis: Donald Trump rules out a third presidential debate before the November 5 election, with Kamala Harris saying "we owe it to the voters".

title.children: Donald Trump rules out another debate with Kamala Harris

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market ends the week on a high, following Wall Street's lead, with expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut next week. See how the day unfolded on our live business blog.

title.children: Australian share market ends the day higher, as Sydney's Star Casino hit with 'show cause' notice — as it happened

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his shoulders sits in a bath and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Clearance divers have among the highest suicide rates of all defence personnel. An ABC investigation has spoken to more than a dozen former divers experiencing a cluster of symptoms they believe is connected to blast exposure.

title.children: These men knew signing up to the Navy would be risky. The toll on their brains wasn't revealed until years later

props.synopsis: Lawyers say the decision has exposed a possible legal fault in how documents were being lodged with Work Cover – the administrative government agency responsible for the workers compensation scheme.

title.children: Potential bureaucratic bungle could see hundreds of workers compensation claims become invalid

image.altText: Young woman lying in bed with her arm over her face trying to get to sleep.

props.synopsis: Whether it's lying awake thinking about the big game tomorrow, ruminating on past performances, or training regimes that start at 4:45am, solid sleep is often hard to come by for high-performance athletes and it can have lasting implications.

title.children: High-performance athletes at greater risk of sleep disorders — even after retirement

image.altText: main pic of the two

props.synopsis: The Miss Universe Fiji voting drama has seen accusations of racism, vote-rigging, conflicts of interest and "conspiracy theories". But in Fiji, the saga is triggering a different kind of response: one of embarrassment and anger.

title.children: Miss Universe Fiji scandal erupts as 'runner up' claims she's the winner two weeks after the event

image.altText: A camo-painted tank sits in the middle of a grey convention centre with people in army uniforms milling about

props.synopsis: The American-made M1A2 will replace an older fleet that's speculated to be donated to the Ukrainian war effort.

title.children: Australia's new army tanks shown off at weapons expo

image.altText: A man in a blue jacket and light pants stands bathed in light at the end of a black tunnel underground.

props.synopsis: A strange signal that shook the planet in September last year has been traced back to a tsunami from a melting glacier in the Arctic. And it may happen again.

title.children: A mysterious underground signal rippled around the world for nine days. Now we know why

image.altText: King Charles said the hugs with team members was 'healing'.

props.synopsis: The New Zealand rugby team delighted King Charles with a "healing" hug. So can we expect a more casual greeting from the monarch when he visits Australia next month?

title.children: King Charles is coming to Australia next month on a royal tour. Can you hug him hello like the NZ rugby team did?

image.altText: A group of little girls smile through a barred window

props.synopsis: In the shadow of a garbage tip lies a multi-generational haven for women and girls in Phnom Penh. Free from the world of men, they study, work and support each other.

title.children: 'We are girls, and we live with only girls': Come inside Cambodia's women-only village

image.altText: A rainbow flag

props.synopsis: The Western Australian government says it "won't have time" to pass a ban on gay conversion therapy before next year's state election, despite a promise made two years ago.

title.children: Western Australia pushes back plan to ban gay conversion therapy

image.altText: Three firefighters with hoses trying to put out an underground fire

props.synopsis: A fire that began in suspicious circumstances is still burning underground south of Bunbury, despite the best efforts of firefighters and one of the wettest winters on record.

title.children: One of WA's longest-burning fires is still smouldering after a million litres of water

image.altText: A man shows a ring to a woman, whose face beams in delight.

props.synopsis: After a five-year hiatus, triple j's regional event returns this weekend. We asked punters for their personal highlights.

title.children: 'The look on her face was pure shock': Your memories of One Night Stand, illustrated

image.altText: Close up of woman's face as she looks upward and reflects on the environment around her

props.synopsis: At the heart of the Tarkine is Australia's largest tract of cool temperate rainforest, but parts of this awe-inspiring wilderness remain unprotected from native tree logging.

title.children: Marta Dusseldorp ventures into the heart of Tasmania's 'spectacular' ancient rainforest

props.synopsis: A lawyer for sexual abuse survivor Adam Kneale says he is searching for more victims of club volunteer Graeme Hobbs, as the club appeals against a payout.

title.children: Western Bulldogs sexual abuse payout faces appeal as new claim emerges against the club

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: A casino dealer employed by The Star casino in Sydney is one of two people accused of rigging multiple games of roulette last year, earning more than $25,000 in the process.

title.children: Casino dealer charged over rigging roulette games at The Star Sydney

image.altText: A Yazidi man and his wife stand on the beach smiling, holding two small children.

props.synopsis: Yazidis living in Australia are petitioning to be recognised in the 2026 census to help ensure they are considered in future policy making and their unique culture is not lost.

title.children: This ancient religion is growing fast in Australia, but it isn't included in the census

image.altText: A scene from the movie Beetlejuice Beetlejuice with Michael Keaton in character as a ghoul in striped suit, weird creature in bg

props.synopsis: The long-awaited sequel to Tim Burton's classic '80s ghostly comedy reveals the old spirit of Beetlejuice is hard to summon — but there is still gooey and gory fun to be had.

title.children: Michael Keaton slips back into the role of Beetlejuice like he's just walked off the set of the original
